content.description: Sit start on the low good holds. Climb Right and up on crimps, pockets, slopers, and jugs.  I think the crux is down low. Figure out your beta to get past the funky crimp/gaston and the good side-pull to hit the pockets.  From there make a big move to a slopey crimp and pull some funky moves to Gain the large crack and top-out.
content.location: To the right of the tree on the first long wall of the maze

content.description: Sit start on Treefrog Right and climb to the pockets and traverse right on holds at about 7ft to a sloper and a mono.  Then finish straight up on the V6.  RAD!!!
Starting in front of the tree at the big half-circle pocket, bump through some thin but decent flakes and on to a big hold at the lip to finish with.Problem #180 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.location: From V-tree, follow wall west/right to a small open grassy area; problem is on face in front of the tree.

content.description: Start down right of the large pocket on edges, move up to it and continue to a good two handed jug at the top to finish with.Problem #179 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.location: From V-tree, follow wall west/right to a small open grassy area; problem is on face left of the tree.

content.description: The problem climbs a tall blunt arete. Head up to a bomber left hand two finger pocket (probably the last point to easily downclimb from) before committing to the upper section with a weird sharp two finger gaston and otherwise less positive holds, eventually passing a couple knobs and the two bolts.Problem #178 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P1.
content.protection: 2 pads, see photo for what seemed the most stable configuration; not the best landing spot. Has 2 TR bolts if needed.
content.location: From V-tree, follow north wall west/right until the problem is visible on right side of narrow gap between walls.

content.description: Just right of a hand crack, climb the face passing a good two finger pocket and dish just above it. Arete/crack are off.Problem #175 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P3.
content.location: From V-tree, follow wall west/right to a long undercut wall just before a small open grassy area; problem is on far right end.

content.description: Another love it or hate it type problem... sit start at the hand crack, follow it up through an abrasive off-width section (and likely lose some skin) before finishing with either face holds along the crack or the final hand jams deep in the crack.Problem #174 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P2.
content.location: From V-tree, follow wall west/right to a long undercut wall just before a small open grassy area; problem is on right end.

content.description: Start with a high flake and edge to the right of it, with good feet. Bump to the pocket, then carefully finish through the much less positive slab above.Problem #173 in Rock Jock's Guide, rated P3.
content.location: From V-tree, follow wall west/right to a long undercut wall just before a small open grassy area; problem is on right end, just left of the crack.

content.description: The Maze is, well it's a maze.  It has most concentrated amount of problems in The Flats.
